Description:
Make Your Mark
Strategically situated steps from Sydney Rd, the appeal of the land ensures that the development/extension (STCA) of this delightful home is an appealing proposition, all the while offering choices to further modernise or enjoy its present charm.
- High ceilings, picture rails and plenty of character
- Inviting archway links lounge and dining areas
- An open fireplace complements gas heater
- Two bedrooms, main with built in robes and air conditioning
- Neat renovated bathroom
- Older style kitchen/meals with terrific potential
- Northerly garden backdrop highlights future options
- Full-size laundry, spacious shed storage
- Stroll to Coburg's best cafes and restaurants
- Close to trams, trains and Upfield bike path
Insights: 2 Marks Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Lifestyle and Position
Located in a secure and stylish apartment complex this apartment provides a fantastic opportunity to invest or live in. Only moments away from local trams, Coburg Lake, Merri Creek trail, local shops and plenty of cafes/restaurants on Sydney Road makes for a perfectly located apartment in a very popular suburb.
Boasting a large master bedroom with walk in robe leading to a well designed ensuite and featuring a good sized balcony with park views, Open plan living/dining area, powder room, separate laundry, modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances, communal pool/BBQ area and undercover parking with storage cage.
Don't miss out on your chance to invest in this blue chip location!
Insights: 204B/1 Manna Gum Court, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2019 and 26 other 1 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
A Cafe Lifestyle Awaits
Promising modern comfort and lifestyle benefits, this single bedroom apartment is an ideal choice for starters, professionals and investors. The interior boasts high ceilings and a spacious layout that allows the open living domain to merge with the double bedroom via a huge slide away door. A Juliet balcony permits extensive views inclusive of city glimpses. The fully appointed sleek kitchen features modern Blanco and Fisher & Paykel appliances, glass splashback and stone bench top while the bathroom boasts a marble top vanity and incorporates a European laundry complete with washer/dryer pair. There's also off street parking, mirrored BIRs and intercom entry. Situated behind "The Boot Factory" cafe, coffee and lunch are no hassle. Also close to Sydney Road shops and tram, beautiful Coburg Lake plus Coburg Market and train station.
Insights: 109/19 Pentridge Blvd, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 26 other 1 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Pretty as a picture
Located in a premium street within the Strathmore College zone, this elegantly renovated, three bedroom California Bungalow will delight families. An elevated leadlight entry reveals a spacious, light filled interior framed by high rosette ceilings. A lounge/retreat precedes a vast open living domain with granite topped kitchen showcasing a suspended canopy rangehood, dishwasher and Smeg cooking appliances. A paved alfresco area overlooks tranquil gardens. Three double bedrooms (plentiful BIRs) access stylish ensuite and central bathrooms. Also with ducted heating, air conditioning, attic storage and driveway. Walk to Melville Road retail junction, Coburg West Primary and Shore Reserve with quick access to CityLink.
Insights: 40 Devon Avenue, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Expressions of Interest
Wow! Beyond the timeless charm of its Federation facade, this amazing home has been transformed into an oasis of luxury and style with its extended design, finest-quality features and sublime low-maintenance surrounds. Meticulous attention to detail, the home's vogue interior showcases three bedrooms (large downstairs master with fully-fitted walk-in robe and luxurious ensuite), dedicated study area, equally-opulent main bathroom and guest powder room (all with floor-to-ceiling tiles). Add to this a spacious and light-filled open-plan living/dining area complemented by a gourmet stone-bench kitchen with breakfast bar, ample cupboard space and premium Bosch appliances. Other highlights include zoned ducted heating/refrigerated cooling, alarm and video intercom, solid hardwood floors, European laundry and adjoining drying cupboard. Dual bi-folds (from the living area) reveal a delightfully private north-facing courtyard complete with entertaining deck, secure storage lockers, built-in decked seating with additional storage space and secure carport via gated driveway (both remote-controlled). Walking distance to local parks, Coburg Station and renowned shopping precinct, it's also close to popular primary schools, Sydney Road cafes and restaurants as well as trams to uni/hospital precincts and the CBD.
Insights: 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
No Owners Corporation
Offering great value and one of only two properties on the block, this freestanding rear villa delivers an impressive low-maintenance lifestyle/investment opportunity with its quality inclusions, private garden surrounds and terrific location in a quiet and convenient Coburg neighbourhood. Filled with natural light, the home's impeccably-presented interior comprises two generous bedrooms (both with mirrored robes) and stylish central bathroom, open lounge/dining area accompanied by a contemporary kitchen with tiled splashbacks and stainless-steel cooking appliances. Other features include ducted heating throughout and additional ceiling fans (lounge and both bedrooms), high ceilings, full-size laundry, plus a wonderfully wide rear courtyard with pergola, established gardens and leafy surrounds for added privacy, as well as the added advantage of an off-street parking space. Moments from the open spaces of Harmony Park and Coburg North Primary School, it's also walking distance to local buses and Coburg North Village, easy access to Melville Road trams, Batman Station and the Upfield Bike Path.
NO OWNERS CORPORATION
Insights: 2/37 Bishop Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 73 other 2 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

The Perfect Starter In Prime Location
Perfect for first home buyers, downsizers and investors, this two bedroom villa unit is freshly presented, comfortable, low maintenance and just a stroll to Coburg's vibrant heart. The kitchen and dining area flows to a well portioned lounge and then further to an entertaining courtyard. Two well-presented bedrooms assure ample accommodation, with built-in wardrobes and accessing a central bathroom. Off-street parking includes a lockup garage and reverse cycle heating and cooling. Low ongoing maintenance and spotless presentation assure strong interest from new buyers, downsizers and investors. Immediate access to bustling Sydney Road shops, restaurants, cafÃ©s, Coburg Railway Station and all within moments to the Melbourne CBD.

Description:
Single level ease, space and serenity on the city edge
Quietly located, well proportioned and boasting individual street frontage to charming Darlington Grove, this immaculate two bedroom single level residence provides all the spoils of city living without the hustle and bustle. Preceded by welcoming entry is a light filled living room warmed by polished hardwood floors. Next door a bright kitchen and adjoining meals zone presents in mint condition. A private rear courtyard is perfect for outdoor dining and relaxing, while its low maintenance qualities make the lifestyle even more appealing. Smart updates enhance two double bedrooms/BIRS. Features renovated bathroom, separate toilet, large laundry, excellent storage, split-system, heater and lock-up garage. Stroll to Nicholson Street and Sydney Road cafes, shops, trams and Merri Creek trails.
Insights: 3/87 Rennie Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 73 other 2 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

A classic combination of period charm, contemporary luxury and quality location, this freestanding single fronted weatherboard beauty draws your immediate attention with its elegant facade. Description:
Perfect in Pentridge
Impeccably presented with a smart interior in the old woollen mills section of the original Pentridge development, this stylish townhouse is sure to make an impression. Spread over two levels this bright and expansive home includes an open plan living/entertaining zone on the ground floor opening onto a private garden courtyard. Upstairs the original beams from the mill days are exposed with two generous bedrooms, both with built in robes and a central bathroom. Other features include split-system air conditioning, second WC and European laundry, plus intercom/secure entry, lower-level parking space and storage cage. Walking distance to Sydney Road trams, popular eateries and renowned retail precinct, it's also close to Coburg Station, Coburg High School, the lush surrounds of Coburg Lake and endless Merri Creek trails.
Insights: 10/1 Industry Lane, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 73 other 2 bedroom unit in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Boutique Luxury in the Heart of Coburg
Tucked away in a stylish contemporary block, this stunning townhouse is sure to make an impression with its clever design, first-class features and unbeatable inner-urban convenience. Immersed in northerly light, the home's meticulously-detailed interior embraces two bedrooms (both with BIR's and deluxe ensuites) and guest powder room - all with stone-top vanities and floor-to-ceiling tiles as well as a separate laundry and private courtyard. Add to this an expansive open-plan living/dining area with stacker doors leading out to a spacious balcony. Other highlights include a stone-bench kitchen with soft-close cabinetry and integrated dishwasher, as well as split-system heating and cooling (living area and both bedrooms), alarm, ample storage, efficient LED lighting and sophisticated matt-black fittings plus secure carport (remote-controlled roller door) via ROW. Walking distance to Sydney Road cafes and trams to uni/hospital precincts and the CBD, it's also close to local parks and popular primary schools as well as Coburg Station and renowned shopping precinct.
Insights: 4/2 Loch Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 58 other 2 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Highly coveted corner potential fronting The Avenue
Extensive frontage along The Avenue highlights the premier position and prized potential of this long-held home on a substantial 680 sqm corner allotment (approx.). The location close to Merri Creek parkland/trails, Sydney Road shopping and Nicholson/Lygon Streets trams and cafes is excellent and bodes brilliantly for buyers looking forward to revitalising the site for exceptional lifestyle rewards. Offered for the first time in 50 years, this rendered solid brick residence is immediately comfortable with irresistible potential to renovate, rebuild or redevelop (STCA). Includes 4 bedrooms, large living room, family/dining area (gas log heater), functional kitchen, terrazzo bathroom, ducted cooling, Jarrah floors, high ceilings, security shutters, alfresco area and carport/garage via The Avenue. 18m frontage.
Insights: 59 Nicholson Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 146 other 3 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Enjoy It Now And Love It Later
Offered for the first time by its original owner-builders, this proudly maintained four bedroom, two bathroom single level brick home includes a self-contained one bedroom/bathroom unit with full kitchen/living and private entry. Whilst enjoyable as is, the home's flexible layout and generous proportions provide excellent scope for future renovations/modern extension (STCA). Set amidst delightful gardens, classic interiors comprise living room, sunroom and large open plan family/meals zones accompanied by timber kitchen, with original gas cooker, presenting in mint condition. Most bedrooms have built-in-robes. Complemented by large family bathroom, two-way bathroom, laundry/study, ducted heating, split- system, timber floors, automated gate and double garage. On land, approximately 587m2, moments from Moreland station, John Fawkner Hospital, schools, Sydney Road trams, cafÃ©s, shops and parklands.

Description:
The Lifestyle
Spacious, vibrant and bathed in natural light are just some of the alluring components this modern 2 bedroom apartment has to attract the astute first home buyer or savvy investor.
Located in the lifestyle hub of Pentridge Village, surrounded by lifestyle advantages, this stylish apartment features spacious open living/dining with connecting large balcony enjoying westerly outlook, modern kitchen with dishwasher for keen cooks, two large bedrooms with built in robes, large bathroom with shower over bath, european laundry, security intercom, heating and cooling and remote control entry to under cover car space and storage cage.
With Merri Creek trail, vibrant Sydney Road shops, cafe, tram, train and Lake Reserve at it fingertips, it's a lifestyle seekers playground.

Description:
Desirable Park side Living.
Hear the birds chirping when you wake up in this stunning park side locale. Enjoy The Pentridge Village lifestyle with cafes and nature at your doorstep.
This highly sought after location is easily accessible to shops, schools, bike paths, walking tracks and public transport.
A large 3 bedroom home that is ready to be enjoyed with a spacious open plan living area opening to an inviting, private rear yard. Upstairs there is a huge master suite which is complemented by an ensuite bathroom and private balcony. The two other bedrooms share a huge central bathroom with bathtub and separate shower. The space in this home makes for effortless family living with dual car accommodation, heating and cooling. With new carpet and fresh paint you can move in and enjoy immediately.

Description:
Renovated with distinction, secluded garden oasis
Prepare to be surprised! This attractive 1920s bay-windowed residence, meticulously renovated for low-maintenance family living, has the special appeal of a Noosa-style rear garden, complete with outdoor shower and bath. Filled with light, the home has a versatile, highly functional floor plan comprising three double bedrooms with Tasmanian oak built-ins (one opening to a study), formal sitting room/4th BR, spacious living/dining room open to a stunning bespoke kitchen (handcrafted cabinetry), 2 mosaic-tiled bathrooms (one ensuite) and euro laundry. Including 2-car off-street parking, a garden studio, workshop and entertaining deck, this exceptional home -- close to Sydney Rd, Coburg Station, schools and parks -- features polished Baltic floors, plantation shutters, Daikin air conditioning throughout, gas heating and solar panels. Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd
Insights: 57 Railway Place, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Secret Transformation
Tucked away from the street, with a high fence maintaining a little mystery, this fully renovated two bedroom home is a stylish revelation you'll love. Step into the open living, meals and kitchen to be immediately met with fresh spaces, gleaming surfaces and an inviting environment. A gas stove, rangehood, sparkling white tiled splashbacks, cupboards and counter space makes the kitchen the perfect place to throw together delicious dishes, and there's room to dine alfresco in the well presented northerly rear courtyard, which also hosts vegie and herb beds. Further welcoming spaces include a northerly balcony and private front courtyard with pops of colour; bedrooms host built-in robes and the shining bathroom is complemented by a laundry and second toilet below. Heating, cooling, a garage with rear courtyard access and highly convenient position ensure appeal. Upfield Bike Path, trains, trams, schools, Sydney Road, Coburg Market and Lake Reserve are all within walking distance - what more could you ask for?

Description:
Classic Californian with a Perfect Parkland Backdrop
Coburg's best kept secret! Blissfully quiet yet enviably convenient, this captivating period home occupies a wonderfully wide block backing onto Merri Creek parkland providing a versatile family environment along with outstanding scope to enhance and expand in the future (STCA). Surrounded by lush gardens, the home's inviting interior comprises three large bedrooms (master with WIR and ensuite), wide hallway with study alcove and central bathroom with laundry facilities. Add to this a light-filled open living/dining area and updated kitchen with walk-in pantry, dishwasher and stainless steel cooking appliances. Other features include solid timber floors and ducted heating throughout as well as a self-contained lower-level studio complete with its own kitchen and bathroom. Outside discover an expansive outdoor entertaining deck with leafy outlook, delightful backyard with extensive brick paving and established gardens, plus under-house storage space, secure carport via side driveway and direct access to trails and parkland. Walking distance to Nicholson Street trams, it's also close to local schools (zoned to Coburg High School), Sydney Road cafes, restaurants as well as Coburg's renowned shopping precinct. What a location! Agent: Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd
Insights: 4 Cole Crescent, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.

Description:
Position and Potential
Framed by a friendly address where the lure of lifestyle is always present, this home's well-maintained original dimensions create an environment that will eagerly respond to renovation ideas. Steps from Melville Rd and zoned to Strathmore College.
- 553 sqm approx
- Completely comfortable in its current form
- Living and dining areas sharing split system and wall heater
- Kitchen/meals that combines family function with charm
- Main bedroom, one of three, with generous built in robes
- Lovely landscaped garden in a green, serene setting
- Right-of-way traversing the rear boundary
- Secure garage with workshop plus driveway off street parking
- Stroll to Melville Rd trams and cafes every day
- Coburg West Primary literally minutes away

Description:
CHARMING BUNGALOW, EXCITING FUTURE!
An enviable location, generous allotment and further scope to improve this original weatherboard home presents an exciting opportunity. Offering immediate and comfortable living as well as a flexible floorplan, explore the potential and create your dream home.
Comprising three generous bedrooms, separate living room, central bathroom, an open plan kitchen/dining area along with a unique rear laneway leading straight into the back garage.
Situated in one of Coburg's most enviable streets, you are just moments away Coburg Market, Coburg Train Station, Sydney Road & Nicholson Street tram lines, parkland, schools and so much more. This prime parcel of Coburg Real Estate is awaiting your inspection.

Description:
Inspired contemporary living
Combining period inspired elegance with contemporary entertaining credentials, this three bedroom plus study, two bathroom home is well situated to offer the lifestyle you want. A picturesque entrance introduces a living room with deep cornices and a lofty ceiling, and polished floorboards continue through to the spacious kitchen/dining/family. Equipped with everything from a gas cooktop to a fan forced oven, dishwasher and walk-in pantry, this family hub is linked by glass doors to an entertainer's deck and rear garden with small deciduous trees. Also featuring heating, cooling, electric shutters, an alarm, rainwater tank and wide carport, electronically accessing a rear ROW, the home sees schools, parks, transport and Melville Road within a stroll and cosmopolitan Sydney Road nearby.
Insights: 74A Saunders Street, Coburg VIC 3058 was last sold in 2018 and 49 other 4 bedroom house in Coburg have recently been sold.
